metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12327 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in ntpq and ntpdc of NTP version 4.2.8p11 allows an attacker to achieve code execution or escalate to higher privileges via a long string as the argument for an IPv4 or IPv6 command-line parameter. NOTE: It is unclear whether there are any common situations in which ntpq or ntpdc is used with a command line from an untrusted source.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3
sntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3').
